result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Pierce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the sentence may be served with huber.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Pierce

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 YEAR (05/11/2017)

1:28 p.m.  Defendant present in court via telephone and without counsel.  Court goes over monies due.  Statement by defendant.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for one year.  Court informs the defendant that if the money is not paid off in the year, court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel.

Court adjourned at 1:30 p.m.
Probation review hearing at 04-04-2016 01:00 pm

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
3:27 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to the charge.  DA concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

90 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 12 months

CONDITIONS:

court costs
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent 

Court grants huber if sentence is to be served.

Court adjourned at 3:33 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 05-11-2015 03:00 pm

2:52 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - had transportation issues and requests another date.  Court will set for Plea & Sentencing on May 11, 2015 at 3:00 P.M.

Court adjourned at 2:53 p.m.
